title: Favorite Classicic?
content:
Amongst the following, which is your favorite (Since I can't create a poll, --[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] :

Biomenace
Commander Keen
Crystal Caves
Cosmo's Cosmic Adventures
Duke Nukem
Monuments of Mars
Secret Agent Man
Wolfenstien
Doom
Jill of the Jungle

Slightly less notable games:
Jazz Jackrabbit
Caste of Winds
Microman
Bad Toys (I've spent hours on this game)


I have played most of these games, but unfortunetly I've never had a chance to play Doom, I didn't really like Wolfenstien (It was messed up on my computer), and I loved the rest.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Favorite Classicic?
content:
Claiming Jazz Jackrabbit as less notable is something akin to sacriliege.

Anyway, Keen, closely followed by Cosmo and Jazz.

title: Re: Favorite Classicic?
content:
You've never tried Doom? Wow, where have you been? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img]

Hehe, anyways, here's my favourite list. Not in any order, except Keen is naturally the best. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

Commander Keen
Wacky Wheels
Crystal Caves
Secret Agent
Duke Nukum (and Nukem II)
Cosmo
Jazz JackrabbitEat your veggies!

title: Re: Favorite Classicic?
content:
Biomenace
Commander Keen
Duke Nukem

Crystal Caves

Monuments of Mars
Wolfenstien
Doom


Never heard of them:
Secret Agent Man
Jill of the Jungle
Jazz Jackrabbit
Caste of Winds

If I play anything other than Keen, I perfer 3d, cause you have more options (If I wanted to, I could recreate keen in Gamemaker in around 2 weeks, and make it work almost perfectly).Proud Leader of the "Tough Guys Wear Pink" Society

content:

How can you have spent hours on it and never have heard of it? "I've spent hours on this game" isn't part of the name, you know. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] [url=http://www.toxicsheep.com]www.toxicsheep.com[/url]

title: Re: Favorite Classicic?
content:
My favourite is a tie between Keen and Hocus Pocus. There just isn't a big enough fanbase for HP... ;_; I'm thinking of maybe doing a fansite for it. Or even a comic, if I can stay committed to it for long enough... >_<

Other games I've played and liked (and remember playing!):
Jazz
Cosmo
Jill of the Jungle
Prince of Persia 2 (never got very far though)
Supaplex
Super Solvers series
Lemmings
Mixed-Up Mother Goose (the first game I ever played!)
Mixed-Up Fairy Tales
In Search of Dr Riptide
Wacky Wheels
Skunny series
Crystal Caves (though I've only discovered it recently)
Pickle Wars

Games I've played but don't really like:
Mystic Towers - the isometric view is awkward, the monsters are hard to hit and hard to kill even when you can hit them... and Baron Baldric is a dirty old man. >_<
Laura Bow: the dagger of Amon Ra - because I could never get past the first bit. >_<[hr]

RocketJess, blasting off again!

[url=http://www.geocities.com/rocketjess]The Dragonkeeper's Lair[/url]

title: Re: Favorite Classicic?
content:
I have a lot of favorties, so why don't I just tell you which ones were just plain horrible

I don't like VGOM any more
There was an game where you were a spaceship, but had nothing to do, which was boring, I don't remember it's name
HURL was stupid
Blinky3 was horrible

And I think that's it. I'll admit that I might of played a little too many games.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-crazy.gif[/img] Signed, Harvey Smith
A proud member of the beta testing society
"I help entertain!" -Harvey
"I always try to consume interesting animals."-LevelLord

title: Re: Favorite Classicic?
content:
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-drool.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-drool.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-drool.gif[/img]

Wacky Wheels!!! OMG!!! I LOVE THAT GAME!!! I used ot have the whole version, but lost it when I crashed our computer years ago (I know now that "Explorer.exe" is an essential part of the OS; some punk told me it was a virus!!! Fudge him [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-furious.gif[/img] )

I spent sooo much time playing it!!!

I love shooting out my bro!!!

Pickle Wars!!! I still have it... only episode I, still have it...
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-drool.gif[/img]

I want to play it... it is really coo, and I really would love to mod it!!!Proud Leader of the "Tough Guys Wear Pink" Society

title: Re: Favorite Classicic?
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]I know now that "Explorer.exe" is an essential part of the OS; some punk told me it was a virus!!![hr][/quote]
Oops. Funnily enough, fixing your computer would have been as simple as popping the Windows install CD back in the CD drive and restarting. Don't you wish you'd known that before?[url=http://www.toxicsheep.com]www.toxicsheep.com[/url]
[img]http://www.toxicsheep.com/sigs/scrobblersig.php[/img]

title: Re: Favorite Classicic?
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Funnily enough, fixing your computer would have been as simple as popping the Windows install CD back in the CD drive and restarting. Don't you wish you'd known that before? [hr][/quote]

Have you ever considered that Windows normally won't let you delete Explorer, and I was a... 6 year older on a mission. I had to delete so much, by the time I was done, our hard drive was rendered useless, and I had also killed our CD drivers!!!

"Sorry dad, I just was trying to rid us of a virus!!!"Proud Leader of the "Tough Guys Wear Pink" Society
[img]http://i15.photobucket.com/albums/a371/najawa/Modding/LLMod.jpg[/img]
"Tough Guys Wear Pink!!!"
-- NAJAWA --

title: Claclaclaclasasassicicicicic
content:
I'd say my list of favourites would go in an order similar to this:

Commander Keen
Jetpack
Tyrian [2000]
Theme Park
Transport Tycoon Deluxe
Tronic
Death Rally
Duke Nukem 3D [Atomic]
[Edit: Ooh, and let's not forget Llamatron 2112!]

However, there are so many oldschool games I love, it's really hard to rank them. All I can say for sure is that Keen is above them all. Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: Re: Favorite Classicic?
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Err, hi, I didn't know you could talk, that's--[hr][/quote]

Actually, I have been able to get my computer to talk quite a bit.

I have it set to vocalize what alice says... and thus, I can actally listen to alice. I also can dictate text into a computer, though I don't have that with me.

Microsoft actually includes voices with Windows XP.Proud Leader of the "Tough Guys Wear Pink" Society
[img]http://i15.photobucket.com/albums/a371/najawa/Modding/LLMod.jpg[/img]
"Tough Guys Wear Pink!!!"
-- NAJAWA --

title: Re: Favorite Classicic?
content:
"Microsoft actually includes voices with Windows XP."

That explains a lot, actually... although I assume you're talking about the ones you hear when you play the CD backwards? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

I've always found their name for one of the voices rather amusing - "Microsoft Sam". Heh.

[quote]Quote:[hr]That explains a lot, actually... although I assume you're talking about the ones you hear when you play the CD backwards?[hr][/quote]

LL: I'd like to return this Linux CD.

Clerk: Uh, why exactly?

LL: There are voices on my player when I play it backwards!

Clerk: Okaaay, no refunds.

LL: They're terrible! I can hear them at night! Telling me to mod more, eat healthily and go to school! Gaieee!
